column1: If you have breathing problems and you: - Are short of breath most of the time - Get short of breath when you walk 150 feet or less - Have been in the hospital for breathing problems recently - Use oxygen at home, even if just at night or with exercise If you were in the hospital for your breathing problems and had: - Pneumonia - Chest surgery - A collapsed lung Also talk to your doctor if you plan to travel in a place at a high altitude (such as Colorado or Utah).
- You will need a prescription for oxygen and a letter from your doctor.
